subject: Re: [junit] Running a precondition before all tests
msgSnippet: ... Yes. Identify the tests that you tend to run as a group, then put them in a smaller suite. Either that or build your own TestCollector that creates a suite
messageBody:
>So said Michael Orozco on 2003-07-11 --------------------
>I am probably doing this all wrong! But If I only want to run certain
>tests. I put a letter in front of the test that I don't want to run, and
>it is ignored at runtime. I do this because junit usually runs the methods
>that have the word test in front of it, and ignores the others.
>
>If there is a better, or proper way to do this please let me know.

Yes. Identify the tests that you tend to run as a group, then put them in a smaller suite.

Either that or build your own TestCollector that creates a suite of the methods you want. It would be relatively easy to build the accompanying GUI to make it simpler to pick tests.

Look at GSBase's RecursiveTestSuite, which allows you to filter tests based on any criterion you can ask the Test object.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
